fields.description:
Bintray is being shut down on May 1. 

https://jfrog.com/blog/into-the-sunset-bintray-jcenter-gocenter-and-chartcenter/

I've made subtasks for the bintray usage other than the dl.bintray.com/apache/arrow repository we use for hosting release artifacts.

comments.body: INFRA-21376 will show ASF recommended migration path.
[~kou] do you know what needs to be done now? (I don't.)

I'm waiting for the next action of INFRA: Integrates Artifactory with LDAP

https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r9200fed3fa812f8c7de07a2500425f258db3231baa8e05f288175e4a%40%3Cbuilds.apache.org%3E

I think that it will not be ready for our 4.0.0 release. So we don't release our 4.0.0 packages with our 4.0.0 source release. We'll release our 4.0.0 packages once Artifactory and LDAP integration is ready.
We don't need to (can't) do anything for now.

FYI: Today and April 26th, 2021, Bintray has a brown-out where packages can't be downloaded as a reminder that the services are going offline. Should the website show a reminder of this for those of us who have encountered this? Also, have you considered uploading artifacts to GitHub releases? It's not as nice as a real repository, but it would at least make the binaries accessible.
We don't copy our packages to GitHub releases. We already have copies on https://apache.jfrog.io/artifactory/arrow/ .
